channel.title: How to change the client IP
channel.description: I have a leeched client with all the java files. and it has all the applet sub1 and class files as java. but idk how to make it so it goes to my servers ip? any ideas?

item.title: How to change the client IP
item.dc:creator: @I_Hawk_I I Hawk I
item.description:
@I_Hawk_I wrote:

Ok, if you know the IP of the origional owner, then I suggest you do a folder search of your client folder for the IP address, if notâ€¦ do the following:

Go into
Client.java

Find (ctrl + f)

public final void init() {

Then under it, should be something on the lines of this

setserver("Example.no-ip.org", "43594");
This is the port that the server is running on, default is "43594" Only change this if you know its on a different port This is the server IP, change it to whatever your IP address is, or your no-ip name e.g "Example.no-ip.org"

Read full topic
item.source: How to change the client IP
